question: The heating of phenyl methyl ether with HI produces an aromatic compound A which on treatment with con. $HNO_3$ gives B. A and B respectively are:
explanation: 1. Cleavage of Phenyl methyl ether (Anisole) with HI gives Phenol (A) and Methyl iodide (due to the stronger aryl-oxygen bond).
2. Treatment of Phenol (A) with concentrated $HNO_3$ results in nitration at ortho and para positions, specifically leading to 2,4,6-trinitrophenol, commonly known as Picric acid (B).
